title: '____ Has joined the lobby' is no longer there in Champion Select and here's why that's bull
body:
Keensense has joined the lobby.
Toxicfiora12 has joined the lobby.
IntingNunu has joined the lobby.
AFKToxicADC has joined the lobby.
MidDownRunner has joined the lobby.

Normally in a ranked match I like to copy and paste this text into op.gg to check my allies op.gg's before the match. Especially if they lock in a mechanically difficult or new champion. If it is their first time ever playing the champion, or if they have a 5% win rate over 50 games on that champion, I will dodge the game.

This does two things: It makes sure that I don't play with players who intentionally feed every game, and it saves my mmr and LP by preventing a loss.

This text is no longer in the client as of the most recent patch, and some players I can still check their op.gg by typing in their summoner name manually. But if their summoner name has special characters that's just impossible. There's nowhere where I can copy-paste their summoner names to check their op.gg.

I could have an inting player with a 5% win rate or a boosted player with a 45% win rate in my game and not even know it because their summoner name is █╤Θ≥. I'd much rather dodge a game than lose because of this.

I contacted support and they said that they believe this is a feature rather than a bug so now I'm complaining.

replies.body: I thought this was a glitch in the client. It wouldn't be the first.
